lead_paragraph: COLEMAN--Zdzislawa Anna, 69, a resident of the Hyde Park neighborhood in Chicago and former employee of NORC, died January 1. She was born on September 24, 1946, in Pietrzykowice, Poland, the daughter of Alojzy and Otylia Walaszek. She received a Ph.D. in sociology from John Hopkins University and lectured at University of Chicago. A lover of art and poetry, she did sculpture when young. Her work as an avid gardener frequently drew praise from people passing by her home. She was a generous person who gave gifts to those around her until the end of her life. She was the beloved wife of James Coleman, whom she married in 1972. He was a professor of sociology at the University of Chicago and died in 1995. Survivors include her son, Daniel; stepsons, Thomas, John, and Stephen; brother, Andrew Walaszek; sister-in-law Camie Corbino-Walaszek; and sister, Miroslawa Walaszek. 1/3
